text: Pakistan is a very diverse country with lots of different ethnic groups and languages. The 17 major groups are Punjabis, Pashtuns, Gujjar, Sindhis, Saraikis, Muhajirs, Balochs, Paharis, Brahuis, Shina, Burusho Hazaras, Baltis, Kohistanis, Khetranis, Siddis and Kashmiris. There are also many other smaller groups like Makranis, Uzbeks, Tajiks, Thari, Kho, Pamiris, Nuristanis, Kalash and many others. == Refugees == The official census in Pakistan doesn't count the 1.4 million registered and 1.7 million unregistered people from Afghanistan who are living in Pakistan. Most of them were born in Pakistan in the last 40 years and are mainly Pashtuns, along with Tajiks, Uzbeks, and others. == References == Category:Ethnic groups in Pakistan Category:Ethnic groups in Asia
title: Ethnic groups in Pakistan
